meanings.definition: Yaupers (noun): People who make loud, raucous noises.
meanings.sent1: The yaupers in the park were shouting and laughing loudly.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors complained about the yaupers having a party late at night.
meanings.sent3: The yaupers at the concert were so noisy, they drowned out the music.
meanings.sent4: The yaupers in the stadium sounded like a flock of excited birds.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the image of the yaupers dancing and singing in the street.

meanings.definition: Yaupers (verb): To make loud, raucous noises.
meanings.sent1: The children yaupers loudly while playing outside.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the wind yaupers through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The cat yaupers at the birds outside the window.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine yaupers as it struggles to start.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks yaupers in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
